parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.04

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Markers

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Creates a [[local]] marker at the given position. Marker exists only on PC that created it.  The marker name has to be unique, if a marker with the given name exists, the command will be ignored. Use [[deleteMarkerLocal]] to delete local marker.<br><br>
If position is given in 3D format, <tt>z</tt> coordinate is stored with the marker and will be used when marker is passed to commands like [[createVehicle]], [[createUnit]], [[createAgent]], [[createMine]], [[setVehiclePosition]] for example. However [[getMarkerPos]] and [[markerPos]] will always return 0 for <tt>z</tt>. 

<br><br><template><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> important </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Local markers have own set of local commands "xxmarkerxxLocal" to work with. If you use global marker command on a local marker, the local marker will become global marker.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[createMarkerLocal]] [name, position, channel, creator]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> [name, position, channel, creator]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> name: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> position: [[Array]] or [[Object]] - format position: [[Position2D]], [[PositionAGL]] or [[Object]] (object's [[PositionWorld]] is used)

</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> channel: [[Number]] - (Optional)The marker side for MP. <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>2.01.146752</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> creator: [[Object]] - (Optional) The marker creator for MP. <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>2.01.146752</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[String]] - The marker's name or empty string if the marker name is not unique.
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_marker = [[createMarkerLocal]] ["Marker1", [[position]] [[player]]];</code>
</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value> createMarkerLocal is local, so it should be used along with the other local commands. For global equivalent use [[createMarker]]

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[allMapMarkers]], [[deleteMarkerLocal]], [[createMarker]], [[setMarkerBrushLocal]], [[setMarkerColorLocal]], [[setMarkerDirLocal]], [[setMarkerPosLocal]], [[setMarkerShapeLocal]], [[setMarkerSizeLocal]], [[setMarkerTextLocal]], [[setMarkerTypeLocal]], [[setMarkerAlphaLocal]], [[deleteMarkerLocal]], [[BIS_fnc_markerToString]], [[BIS_fnc_stringToMarkerLocal]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dt class="note">Unknown <dd class="note">To create a marker which is visible on the map you need to define ''at least'' the following three settings:
<code>_markerstr = [[createMarkerLocal]] ["markername",[_Xpos,_Ypos]];
_markerstr [[setMarkerShapeLocal]] "ICON";
_markerstr [[setMarkerTypeLocal]] "DOT";</code>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
